name: Hebcal
body:
### What is it?
Hebcal is a perpetual Jewish calendar program, implemented in C. The key routines are translations of Dershowitz & Reingold's lisp code in GNU-Emacs 18. Hebcal offers several convenience routines that make it a good fit for generating calendars for PDAs and personal calendars.

Hebcal has been successfully ported to Perl, C, and Javascript, but I'm currently only maintaining the C implementation.

### GitHub now hosts new development
We're using sourceforge for further development on hebcal. Go to the [hebcal project page](https://github.com/hebcal/hebcal) to report a bug, get the latest release, or browse the source.

### [References](references.html)
### [Frequently Asked Questions](FAQ.html)
### [Web Sites Offering access to hebcal data](websites.html)
Hebcal is made available for free under the [Gnu Public License](http://www.gnu.org/licenses/licenses.html). However, I would like to hear from you. If you like hebcal, send me a message! If you don't like hebcal, well, let me know also, but be gentle.

If you wish to fund future hebcal development, you can donate here:
